column4: NVIDIA-Linux-x86-1.0-8178-pkg1.run installs a module called "nvidia", and not "nv" - correct?
if you do it using the nvidia installer you have to chop out the setup nvidia TLS links
after installing it, I can see the modules in /usr/X11R6/lib/modules/ yet the X logs show that it failed to load
I don't understand what you mean exactly
what is "chop out the setup nvidia TLS links"?
complete fucks with the glx settings..
take it out of you /etc/rc.d runlevels
I still don't know what you mean, but I'll fuck with it
the ubuntu method of nvidia is different why then us old school guys use to do it..
yes, I followed a web page (nvidia wiki?) that told me to uninstall nvidia-glx, which I have already done
ok.. so your installing the nvidia stuff from apt?
you have all the kernel sources then?
and built the kernel module then?
